Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; at top, faded band in added white above added red and white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (part of hair, wing with red stroke, body with red patch and foreleg remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, a sphinx that is facing to right is probably part of an antithetical composition of confronting sphinxes. If this sherd is part of an antithetical composition, then the vessel should belong in the Group of Antithetical Sphinxes. Sherds in this group are stylistically early.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 289, no. 869, pl. 119)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1117) (phase 2)
